Dear Sheffield City Council,
1.	Could you please provide the current number of young people placed in supported accommodation by your authority?
2.	Of these young people, how many are placed in supported accommodation directly managed by your authority or through block contract, compared to those placed in supported accommodations provided through spot purchase arrangements?
3.	Are referrals to supported accommodation managed through a specific framework? If yes, could you please specify the name of this framework and detail when it is open to tender?
4.	What is the average weekly fee for placing a young person in supported accommodation during the current financial year?
5.	Could you provide the contact details, including telephone number, email address, and postal address, of the department or individuals responsible for the placement of young people in supported accommodation?
6.	Who are the team managers or key decision-makers involved in the process for admitting a young person into supported accommodation, and may we have their contact details, including telephone number, email address, and postal address?
7.	Is there a current or anticipated need for additional supported accommodation providers/provision within your authority?
8.	Are there specific demographics of young people for whom placement proves to be particularly challenging? If so, could you elaborate on these demographics?
9.	Is there a dedicated team overseeing contracts and/or quality related to supported accommodation? If yes, could you provide the team's contact information?
10.	Who should be contacted for discussions about establishing a new supported accommodation within your authority?
11.	Could you please provide the current number of children who are classified as looked after by your authority?
12.	Based on your data or assessments, do you expect the number of children becoming looked after to increase in the over the next 12-18 months?
Yours faithfully,
Nicole Hemmingway

Dear Nicole Hemmingway,
Thank you for your request for information relating to supported
accommodation which we received on 15/03/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1.          Could you please provide the current number of young people
placed in supported accommodation by your authority?
• To date we currently have 117 young people placed in 16+ supported
accommodation on our framework. 41 of these young people are in
supported tenancies and the remaining are placed in 24-7 group living
provisions.
2.          Of these young people, how many are placed in supported
accommodation directly managed by your authority or through block
contract, compared to those placed in supported accommodations provided
through spot purchase arrangements?
• To date we have 19 young people being placed in Block Booking
provisions.
3.          Are referrals to supported accommodation managed through a
specific framework? If yes, could you please specify the name of this
framework and detail when it is open to tender?
• Yes, Sheffield City Council have their own Dynamic Purchasing
Agreement 16-25 Supported Accommodation Framework which ends on 30^th
September 2024. We are going back out for a new tender early April
2024 via YORtender.
4.          What is the average weekly fee for placing a young person in
supported accommodation during the current financial year?
• Average weekly fee for placing a young person in supported
accommodation depends on the type of placement. 24-7 Group living
average cost per placement £1,544 p/w   Average costs supp tenancy
(floating support) £648 p/w.
5.          Could you provide the contact details, including telephone
number, email address, and postal address, of the department or
individuals responsible for the placement of young people in supported
accommodation?
·       Children Looked After Service - 01142930223
[1][
email address
]
Sorby House, Floor 2, 42 Spital Hill, Sheffield, S4 7LG
·       Leaving Care Service - 01142039060, [2][
email address
]
Sharrow Community Forum, Old Junior School, Vincent Road, Sheffield, S7
1DB
6.          Who are the team managers or key decision-makers involved in
the process for admitting a young person into supported accommodation, and
may we have their contact details, including telephone number, email
address, and postal address?
·       See above.
7.          Is there a current or anticipated need for additional
supported accommodation providers/provision within your authority?
·       Yes
8.          Are there specific demographics of young people for whom
placement proves to be particularly challenging? If so, could you
elaborate on these demographics?
·       Yes. Children with complex needs who need greater support to
develop independence e.g. learning difficulties, those who need floating
support in their own accommodation, YJS involvement and criminality,
substance misuse, exploitation.
9.          Is there a dedicated team overseeing contracts and/or quality
related to supported accommodation? If yes, could you provide the team's
contact information?
·       [3][
email address
]
10.       Who should be contacted for discussions about establishing a new
supported accommodation within your authority?
·       [4]see above.
11.       Could you please provide the current number of children who are
classified as looked after by your authority?
·       678
12.       Based on your data or assessments, do you expect the number of
children becoming looked after to increase in the over the next 12-18
months?
·       Yes, due to NTS referrals for UASC.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [5]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[6]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
